string-array.name: inspire_list
string-array.item: "Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.\n" - "Alan Alda"
"Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.\n" - "Robert Louis Stevenson"
"There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.\n" - "Edith Wharton"
"No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.\n" - "Robin Williams"
"You must do the things you think you cannot do.\n" - "Eleanor Roosevelt"
"We know what we are, but know not what we may be.\n" - "William Shakespeare"
"Everything has been figured out, except how to live.\n" - "Jean-Paul Sartre"
"Big doesn't necessarily mean better. Sunflowers aren't better than violets.\n" - "Edna Ferber"
"I have realized that the past and future are real illusions, that they exist in the present, which is what there is and all there is.\n" - "Alan Watts"
"We don't need to share the same opinions as others, but we need to be respectful.\n" - "Taylor Swift"
"Life is short, and we should respect every moment of it.\n" - "Orhan Pamuk"
"A cloudy day is no match for a sunny disposition.\n" - "William Arthur Ward"
"Time passes irrevocably.\n" - "Virgil"
"Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it.\n" - "Lewis Carroll"
"The world is always in movement.\n" - "V. S. Naipaul"
"Love takes up where knowledge leaves off.\n" - "Thomas Aquinas"
"A kiss is a rosy dot over the 'i' of loving.\n" - "Cyrano de Bergerac"
"The world of reality has its limits; the world of imagination is boundless.\n" - "Jean-Jacques Rousseau"
"A man is but the product of his thoughts what he thinks, he becomes.\n" - "Mahatma Gandhi"
"Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.\n" - "Winston Churchill"
"To fail to love is not to exist at all.\n" - "Mark Van Doren"
"Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.\n" - "Washington Irving"
"Speak clearly, if you speak at all; carve every word before you let it fall.\n" - "Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr."
"Words empty as the wind are best left unsaid.\n" - "Homer"
"The most important thing in communication is hearing what isn't said.\n" - "Peter Drucker"
"Friendship is Love without his wings!\n" - "Lord Byron"
"Be faithful to that which exists within yourself.\n" - "Andre Gide"
"Man is so made that when anything fires his soul, impossibilities vanish.\n" - "Jean de La Fontaine"
"The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.\n" - "Arthur C. Clarke"
"Love in its essence is spiritual fire.\n" - "Lucius Annaeus Seneca"
"Curiosity will conquer fear even more than bravery will.\n" - "James Stephens"
"It's all about quality of life and finding a happy balance between work and friends and family.\n" - "Philip Green"
"Every man dies. Not every man really lives.\n" - "William Wallace"
"When your work speaks for itself, don't interrupt.\n" - "Henry J. Kaiser"
"Only do what your heart tells you.\n" - "Princess Diana"
"Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.\n" - "Pablo Picasso"
"Dreams are necessary to life.\n" - "Anais Nin"
"Music is moonlight in the gloomy night of life.\n" - "Jean Paul"
"A man who gives his children habits of industry provides for them better than by giving them fortune.\n" - "Richard Whately"
"Every failure is a step to success.\n" - "William Whewell"

"If you dream of something worth doing and then simply go to work on it and don't think anything of personalities, or emotional conflicts, or of money, or of family distractions; it is amazing how quickly you get through those 5,000 steps.\n" - "Edwin Land"
"Amazement awaits us at every corner.\n" - "James Broughton"
"In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.\n" - "Christopher Morley"
"Nothing in life is to be feared; it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more so that we may fear less.\n" - "Marie Curie"
"May I never be complete. May I never be content. May I never be perfect.\n" - "Chuck Palahniuk
"That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.\n" - "Marcus Aurelius
"It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.\n" - "Elizabeth Kenny"
"We cannot teach people anything; we can only help them discover it within themselves.\n" - "Galileo Galilei
"Mystery creates wonder and wonder is the basis of man's desire to understand.\n" - "Neil Armstrong"
"Once we accept our limits, we go beyond them.\n" - "Albert Einstein"
"The time is always right to do what is right.\n" - "Martin Luther King, Jr."
"We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.\n" - "Winston Churchill"
"A certain amount of opposition is a great help to a man. Kites rise against, not with, the wind.\n" - "Lewis Mumford"
"There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.\n" - "R. Buckminster Fuller"
"At the center of non-violence stands the principle of love.\n" - "Martin Luther King, Jr."
"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.\n" - "Margaret Mead"
"The less you talk, the more you're listened to.\n" - "Pauline Phillips"
"I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.\n" - "Gustave Flaubert"
"The person who can bring the spirit of laughter into a room is indeed blessed.\n" - "Bennett Cerf"
"We cannot put off living until we are ready.\n" - "Jose Ortega y Gasset"
"The sun does not shine for a few trees and flowers, but for the wide world's joy.\n" - "Henry Ward Beecher"
"The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.\n" - "Henry Ward Beecher"
"My boy, one small breeze doesn't make a wind storm.\n" - "John McGraw"
"Believe and act as if it were impossible to fail.\n" - "Charles Kettering"
"The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.\n" - "Anais Nin"
"The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.\n"- "Oprah Winfrey"
"True happiness is... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.\n"- "Lucius Annaeus Seneca"
"No dream is too big. No challenge is too great. Nothing we want for our future is beyond our reach.\n"- "Donald Trump"
"It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength.\n"- "Maya Angelou"
"Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical.\n"- "Sophia Loren"
"Beauty has so many forms, and I think the most beautiful thing is confidence and loving yourself.\n"- "Kiesza"
"Dreams are the seeds of change. Nothing ever grows without a seed, and nothing ever changes without a dream.\n"- "Debby Boone"
